intro: Struthanthus calophyllus, commonly known as the golden globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Struthanthus calophyllus is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
